meanings.definition: A person who enjoys reading books.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a real bookworm and reads every day.
meanings.sent2: The library is a great place to find bookworms engrossed in novels.
meanings.sent3: The bookworm in our class always has a new book to share with us.
meanings.sent4: She devoured the latest bestseller like a hungry bookworm.
meanings.sent5: His love for reading made him a true bookworm, always lost in a good story.

meanings.definition: A small insect that feeds on the paper and glue in books.
meanings.sent1: We found a bookworm eating through an old encyclopedia.
meanings.sent2: Librarians have to watch out for bookworms damaging the collection.
meanings.sent3: The bookworms in the library were causing quite a stir among the staff.
meanings.sent4: The bookworms seemed to be having a feast on the ancient manuscripts.
meanings.sent5: The rare books were at risk of being devoured by hungry bookworms.
